.class public auto ansi sealed UICuesEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate

type UICuesEventHandler = delegate of obj * UICuesEventArgs -> unit
public delegate void UICuesEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, UICuesEventArgs ^ e);
public delegate void UICuesEventHandler(object sender, UICuesEventArgs e);

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents a method that will handle the event of a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UICuesEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about handling events with delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](/dotnet/standard/events/).
